EDVISIT^50294530^FOUST, FAY^12/14/95^FISHER, CARRIE The patient was seen in conjunction with Dr. Dickerson. I confirm
that I have interviewed and examined the patient, reviewed the
resident's documentation on the patient's chart, discussed the
evaluation, plan of care, and disposition with the patient.
CHIEF COMPLAINT: Chest tightness.
HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS: Briefly, a 65-year-old female with
hypertension and atypical chest pain who comes in with bilateral
chest tightness since 11:00 a.m. and stated that she feels very
lousy after taking her meds and daily has been getting chest
tightness since her discharge recently in which she was admitted
for weakness and hypertensive urgency. The patient stated that
she feels like a "dead mouse." She admits to some headache,
dizziness and continued chest discomfort despite medications.
She had a negative MIBI and neurological workup and has had
significant adjustment for hypertensive medications. Initial
blood pressure is 239/99 upon arrival.
PAST MEDICAL HISTORY: Hypertension and reflux.
SOCIAL HISTORY: She lives with family. No tobacco, drugs or
alcohol.
REVIEW OF SYSTEMS: As documented per written chart.
MEDICATIONS: As per medication list.
ALLERGIES: Penicillin.
PHYSICAL EXAMINATION: Afebrile. Vital signs stable except for
high blood pressure. Awake and alert female, in some obvious
mild discomfort. HEENT: Atraumatic and normocephalic. Neck:
Soft and supple. Lungs: Clear. Abdomen is soft, nontender, and
nondistended. Skin: Intact, warm, and dry. Neurologic: Alert,
oriented, and moving extremities x4.
EMERGENCY DEPARTMENT COURSE: IV placed. Labs sent. EKG is
done. The patient concerned for hypertensive urgency given the
chest pressure and dizziness. We will give ____ 10 mg IV given
the significantly elevated systolic despite compliance with her
hypertensive medication regime to include lisinopril, Toprol-XL,
hydrochlorothiazide, nifedipine, and apparently had a hard time
with blood pressure control in hospital as well. I spoke with
PCP coverage. Given the patient's symptoms and degree of change
of medications, we would admit for further titration of
hypertensive medications in addition, with cycle enzymes. The
patient understands and agrees with plan.
PRIMARY DIAGNOSIS: Hypertensive urgency.
DISPOSITION: Admit to ____.
